This is a Quarto document used to create a much smaller dataset for the MacBERTh model to be trained on.

Author: Lucas Ma

```{r}
# The easiest way to get dplyr is to install the whole tidyverse:
# install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just dplyr:
# install.packages("dplyr")

library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
```


```{r}
ds <- read.csv("genevaBible.csv")
glimpse(ds)
```

The following chunk selects only top 5000 verses to be used for training.

```{r}
ds1 <- ds |>
  slice_head(n=5000)

glimpse(ds1)
```

```{r}
ds1 |> write.csv("shortened_bible.csv")
```
